refnamediv.refpurpose: Disconnect client connections of a given user

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: disconnect_user disconnects clients whose username matches the username_pattern string given as an argument, and returns an integer value giving the number of clients disconnected. This can be used after DELETE USER or REVOKE statement to make sure that the affected user has no open connections.

refsect2.title: username_pattern
refsect2.para: A string pattern to match users to be disconnected. SQL wildcards including Virtuoso extensions may be used:

simplelist.member: '@smith' - disconnects all users whose name resembles 'smith'.
'%' - disconnects all users including the current dba session.

refsect1.title: Return Values
refsect1.para: The number of clients disconnected is returned.

example.title: Disconnect users
example.para: This is how the DBA can close all sessions for all users who name starts with db, including 'dba' which is the DBA itself.
example.screen:
SQL> disconnect_user ('db*');
*** Error 08S01: [Virtuoso Driver]CL065: Lost connection to server at line 7 (7) of Top-Level: disconnect_user ('db*') bash$
